notesStmt.note: Several stained pages, some being also a little damaged.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Pentateuch, Hafṭarot, and parts of the Five Scrolls, with punctuation and accents, provided with masorah magna and parva.

msItem.title: Torah, hafṭarot u-megilot תורה, הפטרות ומגילות
Hafṭarot of the weekly sections, feast and fasts.

collation.p: Originally 14 quires, each of 12 leaves. Currently the first, parts of the second and fourteenth quires are missing. Quires are marked by Hebrew letters on the last page, as well as by Hebrew signatures at the beginning, of which only few have been preserved.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Sefardi square scrip of the 15th century. Moshe (ben Ya῾aḳov) Zabarah, his name inscribed with another hand on folio 103v: ספרא רבא בישראל גדול שמו הרב הקדוש שמו נודע בישראל להלל' אדונינו כמוהרר משה זאברה זיע"א אשרי איש יחזיק בזה הספר ויהיה בבית גנזיו והיתה לבני ישראל למשמרת לדרתם' להגיה ממנו' ספר תורה משה ע"ה: וזכות הרב תגן עליו ועל זרעו אכי"ר.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), a antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Library from him on 09 November 1880 ([148v]).
